events.message: A customer reported a car collision on Main Street involving their vehicle and requested to file a formal accident claim.
The claim was reviewed by the claims department and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of the car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to act as the point of contact for the customer throughout the claim process.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment message to the customer confirming that the claim for the car accident was received.
Documents related to the car accident, including police reports and vehicle damage photos, were requested from the customer for further evaluation.
The customer submitted the requested documents promptly, including the police report and repair shop estimates for the vehicle damages.
The claims team started an investigation into the details of the collision to verify the circumstances and assess liability.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant’s vehicle was damaged in a collision caused by another driver’s negligence.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining the compensation amount for the repairs and other related costs.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication and support received.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance adjuster, confirming the agreed settlement terms with the customer.
Payment for the approved auto accident claim was issued to the customer to cover vehicle repair expenses as per the settlement.
The insurance claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that repairs were completed.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference.
